UTF-16: 2 for characters inherited from GB 2312/GBK (e.g. most Chinese characters) 4 for everything else.

column7: UTF-32 base64 the table become too wide  rewritten UTF-32 as a text below the table -->

UTF-8: 1 for "direct characters" (depends on the encoder setting for some code points)  2 for U+002B "+"  otherwise same as for 000080 – 00FFFF
5 for an isolated case inside a run of single byte characters. For runs per character plus padding to make it a whole number of bytes plus two to start and finish the run
UTF-EBCDIC: 2–6 depending on if the byte values need to be escaped
GB 18030: 4–6 for characters inherited from GB2312/GBK (e.g. most Chinese characters) 8 for everything else.
column7: for characters inherited from GB2312/GBK (e.g. most Chinese characters) for everything else.

UTF-8: 8 for isolated case  per character plus padding to integer plus 2 for a run
UTF-EBCDIC: 8–12 depending on if the low bytes of the surrogates need to be escaped.
